title: zaradulu the mythmaker to reveal the pranks shes played on you
story: Speaking earlier in the year, Zardulu revealed she had five different pieces in five different places at various stages - including in the UK."Some are as subtle as hoping to raise a single eyebrow, some are as grandiose as to hope they&#8217ll be international news stories," she said."I had a piece unexpectedly get distributed by an international news wire... I didn&#8217t expect the reaction to it would be so great."Her existence was revealed in January 2016, after an actor who claimed to work with her grew frustrated with her.Embodying much of the spirit of the trickster god Hermes, who Zardulu says she prays to, she has "collaborators" across the world who help carry out pieces she feels can be done without her presence.She also claims to have spoken with Banksy, the anonymous UK street artist, about a collaboration.The New York based artist is credited with manufacturing events designed to capture the eye of the public, news editors included.Some of her other 'hits' include staging photos and films of a racoon riding a crocodile, a man catching a three-eyed fish in a New York canal and an iguana turning up in a family's toilet and proceeding to bite a man's testicles.She trained a rat - now known as Selfie Rat - to run across an apparently sleeping man's lap and phone, causing the camera turn on and film the incident.Pizza Rat has been viewed more than 10m times and made headlines around the world, with news editors everywhere jumping on the chance to feature the 'stranger than fiction' story that tends to draw in the clicks.It's hard to know when to believe Zardulu, whose very motivation is to play with truth and myth."I&#8217ve appeared in news stories as around 60 different personas. Some of them I spend years developing," she said.In conversation, she comes across as well educated and with a vast knowledge of art history and the lore of gods - ranging from those in Ancient Greece to Hinduism to Norse mythology .She says the iguana in the toilet, which she entitled The Usurpation of Ouranos, was an "homage" to Marcel Duchamp&#8217s toilet and "a ritual to the trickster spirit that resides on both of us [her and the French artist]".Zardulu explained to Sky News: "I don&#8217t believe I&#8217m a god, but I&#8217ve been possessed by one."The same way shamans wear masks and perform rituals to call upon gods to enter them. From a humanist standpoint, this represents the journey into the subconscious. It&#8217s casting a net into the deep ocean inside all of us, and drawing something out of it."Zaradulu the mythmarker's New York exhibition, entitled Tricornis Aeternis: Rites and Mysteries, is billed as "a series of works encompassing installation, drawings, a book of Zardulism (sharing the exhibition&#8217s title), and an online component."So much of Zardulu's work comes alive once it begins to be shared online, often on social media."A form of performance that I think gets over-looked in the mythologizing ourselves on social media. These digital representations are the way we want to world to see us, they are very far from reality," she explains.She continued: "I think a facet of the net art movement that will soon emerge will be in the fabricated social media presence. Mythologized version of the artists or the artists putting themselves in surreal contexts, like a Frida Kahlo painting for the modern era.""I enjoy an oil painting, but what does an oil painting reflect about the digital age?"Speaking about her upcoming show at Transfer Gallery in October, she said: "I think people will enjoy seeing the pieces that physically manifest my performances, the physical objects I created to write a compelling narrative around.

title: tories accused hiding government whatsapp
story: NewsTories accused of 'hiding' government WhatsApp messages revealing how they keep Theresa May in powerEXCLUSIVE: Officials have sparked fury by insisting the messages should be kept secretShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter18:44, 16 AUG 2018Updated18:46, 16 AUG 2018NewsThe Government have refused to reveal the 'WhipsApp' messagesGet politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTop Tories were last night accused of hiding official government WhatsApp messages revealing how they are keeping Theresa May in power. Experts say communications between Tory whips should be released to the public. But the Cabinet Office has sparked fury by insisting the messages be kept secret. Government whips have frequently used messaging apps to coordinate Commons votes. The Mirror lodged an application for the messages sent through the chat - known as ‘WhipsApp’ - to coordinate Government business. But officials stunned transparency campaigners by claiming the messages are exempt from Freedom of Information laws because they are ‘political’ in nature. But the 17 Government whips are public office holders - effectively ministers. They pocket between &pound25,000 and &pound80,000 of taxpayers’ money on top of their MPs’ salary for doing the job.  FOI expert Matthew Burgess said: “Governments shouldn’t be avoiding transparency by hiding their work away from public view. Government business needs to be done in a clear way - there are exemptions in the FOI laws to allow policy discussions to be kept private - and that means making sure good records are kept.” “Technology shouldn’t be used as an excuse to circumvent openness.” Maintaining discipline in parliamentary votes has become vital to keeping Theresa May in office, since she lost her Commons majority in last year’s election. The Whips have reportedly used the WhipsApp group to maintain that organisation in a string of knife-edge votes, where the Prime Minister faced embarrassing defeats. And it is used to discuss so-called ‘pairing arrangements’, where MPs who cannot attend the Commons due to sickness or maternity leave.

title: union boss len mccluskey calls
story: NewsUnion boss Len McCluskey calls on Labour to adopt full anti-Semitism definitionBut the Unite general secretary prefaced his comments with a blistering attack on Jewish community leaders for what he called their "intransigent hostility" to Mr CorbynShare&nbspByMikey SmithPolitical reporter17:24, 16 AUG 2018Updated18:20, 16 AUG 2018News (Image: Daily Mirror)Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailUnion boss Len McCluskey has called on the Labour Party to adopt the globally recognised definition of anti-Semitism.  Mr McCluskey, who is a close ally of Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn , said the party had been insensitive in not adopting the International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA) definition in full.  But the Unite general secretary, writing for HuffPost UK, prefaced his comments with a blistering attack on Jewish community leaders for what he called their intransigent hostility to Mr Corbyn. Mr McCluskey said the problem of anti-Semitism in the party was not manufactured but had certainly been wildly exaggerated. He said: I am at a loss to understand the motives of the leadership of the Jewish community - the Board of Deputies, the Jewish Leadership Council and the Jewish Labour Movement. They raised entirely proper concerns, but have simply refused to take 'yes' for an answer.  Mr McCluskey said the more Corbyn has personally sought to build bridges with the Jewish community, the worse the rhetoric has become. He added: What is the response from the leading Jewish community organisations to this record of reaching out, of understanding, and of action? Intransigent hostility and an utter refusal to engage in dialogue about building on what has been done and resolving outstanding difficulties.  I therefore appeal to the leadership of the Jewish community to abandon their truculent hostility, engage in dialogue and dial down the rhetoric, before the political estrangement between them and the Labour Party becomes entrenched.  Mr McCluskey, calling for the IHRA definition to be adopted, said: Clearly, it would have been far better for the party to have adopted at least ten of the eleven IHRA examples in their original wording. Not doing so - and particularly without adequate consultation - was insensitive and bound to lead to misunderstanding, and also served to distract attention from the real issues at stake. It would be for the best if all eleven were now agreed, so the party can move on.

title: audi owner wins 10 month
story: NewsAudi owner wins 10-month compensation battle after £92k car damaged by loose road chippingsRobert Johnston successfully took a road resurfacing contractor to the small claims courtShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByAimi Redfern23:01, 16 AUG 2018Updated00:46, 17 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA driver has won a lengthy 10-month battle after his new &pound92k Audi was damaged by loose road chippings. Robert Johnston successfully took a road resurfacing contractor to the small claims court after the firm refused to reimburse him for the damage. Mr Johnston's A6 was parked outside his business in Silverdale Road, Newcastle , last September when it was chipped by loose stones following the surface dressing of the road, the Stoke Sentinel reports. The 42-year-old repeatedly contacted both Staffordshire County Council, which is responsible for the road, and the firm contracted to carry out the work, Knutsford-based Road Management Services (RMS), with his concerns about the standard and safety of the surface.  RMS eventually wrote to Mr Johnston to say it had inspected the site and found 'no signs of loose aggregate' - and would therefore not offer him any compensation. Mr Johnston then launched a legal battle and, following a hearing at Stoke-on-Trent County Court, a judge ordered RMS to pay him &pound4,211.20 in compensation, plus &pound745 to cover his legal costs. The businessman, who owns Silverdale Motors, said: The court case was a dark cloud hanging over me. I was representing myself and it was quite a daunting experience. When the judge ruled in my favour I was really happy. It has been 10 months of hard work but it paid off. When you are right, you're right. The company has been negligent. Despite winning his legal battle, Mr Johnston remains concerned about the state of Silverdale Road.  The county council said if work on the road network was not up to standard, the contractor would have to remedy this at their own expense. Helen Fisher, cabinet member for Highways and Transport, said: “We have more than 6,000km of roads and the surface dressing programme plays a key role in reducing the risk of potholes.

title: amazon drivers abusive note left
story: NewsAmazon driver's abusive note left for single mum has left her 'too scared to answer the door'Lisa, Jane Watson, from Warrington, Cheshire, was unable to be there for the package because her mother was in hospital with a broken hipShare&nbspByRachel BishopJohn Glover13:16, 16 AUG 2018NewsLisa Jane Watson was astonished to find the note (Image: Deadline News)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA single mum was left 'frightened' after an Amazon driver angrily accused her of messing him about when she wasn't home to collect a package. The driver is under investigation after Lisa Jane Watson said he left her an official missed delivery note that had been scrawled on in blue biro: Pick up yer fone in future. The delivery driver added: Messed me about. You wasted half an hour cos of you. Lisa Jane Watson, from Warrington, Cheshire, was unable to take delivery of the package because her mother was in hospital with a broken hip. Lisa, 45, says she received 13 calls from an unknown London landline around the time of the delivery.  She answered on three occasions but the line was empty each time, meaning she ignored subsequent calls. The primary school teaching assistant says the disgusting note has made her scared to order online again and she has told her children not to answer the door. Lisa, an Amazon Prime customer, ordered Yankee candle plug-in refills on Monday and was told to expect delivery on Tuesday. She said: I had a couple of phone calls around lunchtime, which came up on my mobile as a London number. I ignored the first call but when they called back I answered it, the call then ended. They called again and I answered but again the call ended.  I then suspected it was a scam as it was a London number. I was then called numerous times but I declined each call. It was really frightening to receive so many calls like that. She added: I then arrived home at teatime to the note through the door and my parcel was left with a neighbour. As a single mum with two young girls. It's quite frightening that there is a driver out there that is that angry with me. I'm scared to order anything again. When I saw the same neighbour he left it with getting a delivery, I was terrified that he [the driver] may come over to confront me. My safety chain is always on now and I've told my girls not to answer the door. I got enough on my plate without all this added stress. Amazon sent Lisa an email which read: I would like to express my sincerest apologies for the note that our driver has left when attempting delivery of a recent parcel.

title: britains oldest clown 85 says
story: NewsBritain's oldest clown, 86, says he will keep working until he diesStill performing eight shows a week, even at 86 the idea of retirement sounds ridiculous to Brian DewhurstShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByJames Desborough21:29, 16 AUG 2018NewsBrian Dewhurst is Britain's oldest clown (Image: JDMC)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailHe’s had audiences in &shyhysterics for decades and Britain’s oldest working clown Brian Dewhurst &shyintends to have the last laugh, even if it means dying while on stage. Still performing eight shows a week, even at 86 the idea of retirement sounds ridiculous to him. Brian believes he’ll carry on clowning until his final curtain. He says: “I joke to colleagues, ‘If I don’t come out of the box on stage just take it away and bury me’. “I feel alive on stage, so to take a final bow would not be such a bad way to go. I can’t stop working. It’s in my blood.” Brought up in Manchester with his grandma while his circus-performer parents Manz and Chico toured the world, Brian believes he was born to entertain. At 13 he did skits at a local zoo and loved it so much he left school a year early for a circus career.  “Something about the circus just drew me in,” he says. “When I was with my parents in the school holidays it would be natural to try juggling, rope throwing and things like discipline and work ethic. “Working as a clown’s assistant, hearing the audience react with laughter and applause was my reward and felt it was my natural home. I just felt like I belonged.” In a career spreading joy across the world, Brian won fans among Hollywood’s greatest stars, coached acrobatics to Great Britain athletes and, most proudly, performed with his &shychildren Nicky and Sally.  For the past 20 years he has starred as the mischievous Brian Le Petit in Cirque Du Soleil’s show Mystere in Las Vegas. Recently he was honoured with a Las Vegas award for lifetime achievement, alongside Nicky. Brian says: “To be celebrated like this is astonishing as I never set out in my career to win awards, just entertain people. Working with the public keeps you fresh and on your feet. You never know what the audience will do – it makes it exciting and fun to go to work.  “I don’t think about my age really, it is just numbers. A lot of the Mystere troupe are around a third of my age. I find I feed off the energy of these whippersnappers. And I don’t think about stopping, What else am I going to do?” Brian has mastered far more than slapstick stunts and became known as one of the best tightrope walkers on the circus circuit. He says: “I was always athletic and sporty, so the wire was a starting point to expand on tricks. “For practice it was a couple of feet above ground, but I took one step out and then continued walking.  “I didn’t even think of coming off. It was just as normal as walking down the street. “Then I built into the act skipping, dancing and juggling while up there. I loved to get the laughs.” Brian also fell in love with singer Julie Dey and they married in 1959 and toured the world with their cabaret act. He says: “It was a great life. I’ll never forget the year in Africa, playing 200 shows, travelling by train. On the back car you could sit on the balcony, watching lions, giraffes and elephants in their habitat.  “Wherever we went we made friends and learned so much. Every day was an adventure and I had Julie to share the ride.” In 1965 Brian was flown to New York to appear on The Ed Sullivan Show four weeks before The Beatles performed. He says: “It was a big show and an honour, but I saw it as well-paid gig. People today would see that as an opportunity to break into TV and movies, but I was settled in my career.  “Afterwards an agent offered me a season at Radio City Music Hall but I wanted to get back to London to be with my wife as we’d just had our daughter Sally. “It never entered my mind to grow a career and try for Hollywood. If I stayed who knows if movies would have called? “But I don’t regret anything. Family had always been important to me and I was not going to leave to build a career thousands of miles away.” Brian bought an 18-bedroom property in New Cross, South East London, to use as both a family home and rental spot.  He and his wife’s parents moved in to help care for Sally and younger son Nicky while he performed his tightrope act. Brian was a coach for several Great Britain members in the late 1970s but the circus drew him back in and he joined London’s Circus UK as assistant director. At the same time what was then a small French-Canadian company, Cirque du Soleil, which was doing similar shows, came calling.  He says: “The bosses saw what we did and asked us to go to Montreal for workshops. I didn’t realise that was their audition. “They loved my comic ringmaster so much that they hired me for that and to work the tightrope with Sally and Nicky. It reinvigorated me with a love for the circus as I was now well into my 50s.” Cirque created artistic coordinator roles for Brian at new shows in Las Vegas and Europe. But on the opening night of “O” in Vegas in 1998 Julie died of pancreatic cancer.

title: brit gran 81 centre benidorm
story: NewsBrit gran, 81, at centre of Benidorm holiday storm reveals truth behind 'too many Spanish people' remarksEXCLUSIVE: Retired care assistant Freda Jackson, who shot to international notoriety over her complaints, has slammed media coverage as "disgusting" and says she feels "betrayed."Share&nbsp&nbspCommentsByLiz Dunphy17:19, 16 AUG 2018Updated18:34, 16 AUG 2018NewsFreda Jackson, 81, said she's been painted as a racist and claimed her comments were taken out of context (Image: SUPPLIED)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA British pensioner has revealed the truth behind reports she said her Benidorm holiday was ruined by 'too many Spanish people' Freda Jackson, 81, said she's been wrongly painted as a racist and claimed her comments were taken out of context and she feels betrayed. Mrs Jackson received a huge backlash after she was quoted saying Spanish people ' should go somewhere else for their holidays ' following her trip with a friend to Poseidon Playa through travel operator Thomas Cook. Her granddaughter, Lyndsey Jackson, 32, has accused people of bullying after thousands slammed her for saying her accommodation was teeming with 'rude' native Spaniards - who nearly knocked her over on one occasion. The retired care assistant told  from her hospital room where she's recovering from knee surgery: It's all a pack of lies. I never said the Spanish should go to another hotel, just that the hotel didn't cater to English people. It's been totally taken out of context.  Now people who don't even know me are calling me racist which is just not true. I didn't slag the Spanish off at all. I had asked for a hotel in Benidorm's new town, on the flat that was close to shops. But they gave me a hotel on a hill in the old town far from everything. Mrs Jackson, who worked as a carer and auxiliary nurse for most of her life, said the public backlash against her has been disgusting. She suffers from chronic arthritis and went into hospital on Monday for a knee replacement. But as she came out of theatre, in serious pain and confined to hospital, she was met with the news that story had hit the headlines.  Mrs Jackson had booked to stay at the Poseidon Playa, located on the outskirts of Benidorm in south east Spain, with a friend in April 2017. The pensioner says Thomas Cook had even recommended the hotel and despite her request for flat ground access, it was located on a slope instead. Mrs Jackson and her 61-year-old friend paid a total of &pound1,133 for the holiday and have demanded a full refund or a free trip. Ahead of the trip the flights from Manchester to Allicante had been changed but she was not informed until she went to collect her tickets. Added to the that the hotel was not in the location she requested and she found it difficult to get around with her painful knee and mobility issues. She said she had never complained about a holiday before, but added that this one was a disaster from start to finish. She was quoted saying the 'hotel was full of rude Spanish holidaymakers' and that the entertainment in the hotel was all focused and catered for the Spanish adding: Why can't the Spanish go somewhere else for their holidays?

title: cop run over van chasing
story: NewsCop run over by his OWN VAN while chasing after a wanted manThe officer had to have hospital treatment for leg injuries after the accident in ManchesterShare&nbspByDamon Wilkinson23:41, 16 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA cop was injured when he was run over while chasing a suspect - by his OWN van. The officer had to have hospital treatment for leg injuries after the accident in Manchester. Footage shows the van pulling up at a junction, where the cop jumps out and starts to pursue a man standing on the pavement. The Greater Manchester Police van follows, and the officer on foot is hit, the Manchester Evening News reports. Detectives said it showed how officers ‘put themselves in difficult situations to keep our streets safe on a daily basis’.  The collision took place at around 3pm on Thursday afternoon. A GMP spokesman later confirmed that the officer who was hit by the van was chasing a man he believed to be wanted at the time. A 29-year-old was arrested after the collision on prison recall, the spokesman added. A spokesman for the North West Ambulance Service said: “We received a call at 3.03pm. “We sent an ambulance and a rapid response vehicle to the scene. The patient was taken to North Manchester General Hospital with leg injuries.”  Detective Chief Inspector Amanda Delamore from GMP’s Salford Borough said: “Officers put themselves in difficult situations to keep our streets safe on a daily basis, and sadly on this occasion it has ended with one of our officers in hospital. “My thoughts are with the officer, we wish him a speedy recovery and hope to have him back protecting us all as soon as possible.”

title: cops investigate recording manchester mosque
story: NewsCops to investigate recording of Manchester mosque sermon scholars claimed 'called for armed jihad'Mustafa Graf allegedly told those at the sermon “now it is time to act” and included prayers for “Mujahideen”Share&nbspByPaul Byrne21:00, 16 AUG 2018Updated06:52, 17 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAn imam at the mosque where Manchester Arena bomber Salman Abedi worshipped called for an armed jihad just months before the concert attack, it has been claimed. Mustafa Graf allegedly told those at the sermon “now it is time to act” and included prayers for “Mujahideen” - a term used for a group fighting armed jihad abroad. The BBC has obtained a recording of Graf’s address and the corporation understands Abedi bought at ticket for the Ariana Grande concert 10 days later. Abedi killed 22 and injured hundreds at the concert when he detonated a suicide bomb. One Muslim expert last night said Graf’s sermon was “brainwashing” young people. Abedi, aged 22, and his family regularly attended the mosque in Didsbury south Manchester and his father Ramadan sometimes led the call to prayer.  It is unknown whether Abedi – or any family members - attended the mosque on the day of the audio recording. The sermon by Mustafa Graf, which was delivered at the time of the bombing of Aleppo, included prayers for “Mujahideen” – a term used for a group fighting armed jihad abroad. “We ask Allah to grant them Mujahideen - our brothers and sisters right now in Aleppo and Syria and Iraq - to grant them victory”, he says. Elsewhere Graf says, “Jihad for the sake of Allah is the source of pride and dignity for this nation”. In another passage he says “now it is time to act and do something”.  The sermon centres on the suffering in Syria and includes an appeal for donations, with Graf at one point saying “the whole world, including Europe, America, what is the so-called civilised world” is watching what is happening in Aleppo and Syria. “They know that Iran, Russia and the militias are killing humans in Syria and they do nothing. Well in fact they helped Iranian, Russian and others to kill Muslims over there.” BBC News played the audio for two Muslim scholars who said they both believe the language of the sermon represents a call for armed jihad.

title: horrified dad pulls metal coil
story: NewsHorrified dad pulls METAL COIL from three-year-old son's throat - after he chokes on crispsEXCLUSIVE Preston Green was eating cheese and onion Wheat Crunchies when he approached his parents Adam and Chelsea, from Market Harborough in Leicesterhsire, complaining something was trapped in his throatShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByAbigail O'Leary21:02, 16 AUG 2018Updated21:03, 16 AUG 2018NewsPreston approached his parents gagging on the spring which was stuck in his throat (Image: Adam Green)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA horrified dad pulled a two-inch METAL COIL from his three-year-old son's throat after he began choking on crisps. Preston Green was eating cheese and onion Wheat Crunchies when he approached his parents Adam and Chelsea, from Market Harborough in Leicestershire, gagging and complaining something was trapped in his throat. In a desperate rush to save his son’s life, panic-stricken Adam, 26, smacked Preston on the back before a silver object, around two inches long, shot out of his mouth. Adam and 24-year-old Chelsea were horrified when they realised their son had been choking on a spring - which they claim came from the crisp packet.  Describing the horrific ordeal which occurred at their family home on Wednesday, Adam told the : We always buy the Wheat Crunchies because they are the boys’ favourite crisps. “We’d bought a multi-pack from Home Bargains in Kettering and Preston asked for a packet so I grabbed a bag to give to him. “Minutes after he started eating them, he runs up to us and starts complaining something was in his throat - he was gagging and choking.” The horrified parents, who also have son Leyton, aged five, reacted instantly, realising something was trapped Preston's airway.  Adam added: “I smacked him on the back and got it out. It was part of a crisp, but wrapped around it was this spring. “It was the size of the Wheat Crunchie - about two inches long I would say.” Adam said Preston went on to complain of pain in his teeth after the traumatic ordeal, likely caused by the spring which he had unknowingly bitten down on. The dad added: It was frightening, but thankfully nothing really serious happened, and Preston is OK, apart from complaining about pain in his teeth. Adam took pictures of the spring and contacted manufacturer KP Snacks, revealing how they had gone through one of every parent's worst nightmares - witnessing their child choking on a piece of food.

title: night stalker obsessed burglar scrawled
story: NewsNight Stalker-obsessed burglar scrawled satanic symbols on walls as he rifled through victims' underwear drawersConor Ashton, who nicknamed himself 'The Stalking Ransacker,' held terrified victims at knife point and lay their underwear out on beds during raids at homes across ColchesterShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByJames Hore14:57, 16 AUG 2018Updated15:12, 16 AUG 2018NewsConor Ashton nicknamed himself 'The Stalking Ransacker' (Image: SWNS- Cambridge)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA twisted burglar who admired infamous American serial killer the 'Night Stalker' has been jailed after carrying out a string of burglaries at women’s homes across Colchester. Conor Ashton, who nicknamed himself 'The Stalking Ransacker,' targeted single women and held them at knife point while rifling through their underwear drawers. Most of the time, the victims were not at home. But on the last two occasions before he was arrested, he broke into the homes of two women while they were asleep. The dangerous 23-year-old stood over the victims as they slept before using plastic cable ties to bind them while he ransacked their homes, stealing debit cards and phones. He helped himself to hot chocolate and wine as he rooted through their underwear drawers and then laid out garments on beds. A court heard how in a number of disturbing raids, Ashton tagged the houses of his victims with bizarre graffiti which included insults directed at police officers, and pentagrams.  He even left a running total of the number of burglaries he said he had carried out across a four-year period in the Essex town. Chelmsford Crown Court heard how Ashton was obsessed with Satanic killer Richard Ramirez who murdered at least 14 people in attacks that terrorised California in 1985. Cold-blooded killer Ramirez, who started out with burglaries, also left occult symbols at his crime scenes. Ashton was finally arrested by cops with an expert linking his handwriting to the graffiti left behind at homes he’d raided. The former farm worker admitted six counts of burglary and two charges of aggravated burglary. Dressed in a green tracksuit top, white shirt and blue jeans, he cried during his sentencing hearing.  As he was jailed today Judge Christopher Morgan branded him a dangerous offender who had targeted young single women. Stephen Rose, prosecuting, revealed shocking details of the crimes which began in 2013. Ashton burgled a series of university student properties close to his Colchester home but by last year the raids became shockingly violent. On July 10 last year a woman woke to find Ashton next to her bed ‘pointing a blade in her direction’. Mr Rose said: ‘He told the victim not to scream. “He was wearing a black balaclava, black top, black trousers and wearing black gloves and a black rucksack.” Twisted Ashton told the woman to hand over her debit card and pin number, warning her that her housemate was being held by another man.  “He told the victim he would not hurt her, instructed her to lie back before producing two plastic ties and tied her hands and ankles,” Mr Rose said. Ashton then left and his victim waited 20 minutes before calling out to her housemate who was fine and had not seen another person in the house. Ashton, whose family were sat in the packed courtroom, used the debit card to take &pound500 out in three separate withdrawals. Just a month later, on August 14, he broke into a home and tied up another woman with cable ties. She ran shouting and screaming from her home into the arms of her shocked neighbours.  The woman told police she had woken up to the sight of a man at the end of her bed. Balaclava-clad Ashton told her he would not harm her and asked for money before tying her wrists. Mr Rose said Ashton told the woman ‘tell the pigs I had fun on Avon Way [the scene of his earlier raid]. “I already know my next target. It will be next week sometime.” Detectives investigating the case located a laptop stolen in a burglary which they traced back to Ashton. Police arrested Ashton the following month and during a search of his house they found a backpack containing gloves, a balaclava and zip ties.  Officers noticed how Aston had drawn pentagrams on his walls. His computer was seized and it revealed a search for ‘the original night stalker’ as well as for British Army forensics. Mr Rose added: “Part of the Crown’s case is the defendant appears, to some extent, to have modelled himself on a serial offender in America.” The court heard how Ashton had left graffiti in the houses appearing to taunt police. In one case he wrote: 'The Stalking Ransacker’, '35th burglary'. 'Police Suck’, ‘Media Attention’. Ashton’s handwriting from a college application was matched by an expert to the graffiti. He denied involvement at first before later changing his pleas and admitting the string of raids. Richard Conley, mitigating, said the offences were completely out of character for Ashton, suggesting they had in some part been due to him using drugs.

title: polar bear weighing 97 stone
story: NewsMassive polar bear weighing 97 stone undergoes allergy test after hay feverA team of three vets, a nurse, three dermatologists and five more park staff were on hand when 97.6 stone (620kg) Victor needed to be given an allergy testShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByTom Wilkinson16:52, 16 AUG 2018Updated16:54, 16 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIt is not just hay fever sufferers who have struggled with pollen this summer - two of the polar bears at Yorkshire Wildlife Park have been caused major discomfort too. A team of three vets, a nurse, three dermatologists and five more park staff were on hand when 97.6 stone (620kg) Victor needed to be given an allergy test. Such was the bear's bulk, Press Association photographer Danny Lawson was also asked to put down his camera and help manoeuvre Victor into a comfortable position after he had been anaesthetised. A major operation was put in place after Victor and his smaller friend, Nobby, began suffering from abscesses on their feet.  Staff suspected it was caused by an allergic reaction to pollen after moving from concrete bear pit enclosures elsewhere to the more natural setting at the attraction near Doncaster. Dermatologists from Liverpool University were brought in to carry out tests on Victor's skin, once he had safely been put under, to verify the theory. The results will be known in the coming days.  Animal manager Debbie Porter said: It has been a bonkers day. Victor was shaved and there are about 50 test sites on his side. Fingers crossed we can find out which allergies he has and we can set about making life more comfortable for him.

title: princess dianas explosive feud mum
story: NewsPrincess Diana's explosive feud with her mum - who called her a whore in last phone callsPrincess Diana asked friend Paul Burrell to listen to two shocking phone conversations she had with mum Frances Shand KyddShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByZoe ForseyActing Audience Editor15:16, 16 AUG 2018Updated15:48, 16 AUG 2018NewsPrincess Diana with her mum Frances Shand Kydd (Image: WireImage)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailMeghan Markle's difficult relationship with her family, especially her dad Thomas, has reportedly been causing the duchess increasing distress and concern in recent months. But she's not the first royal bride to have family troubles, and her late mother-in-law vowed never to speak to her mum again after a series of shocking conversations. Princess Diana's butler and close friend claims Frances Shand Kydd called her a whore and launched into a hate-filled personal attack on the men she was dating and their religious beliefs. During an interview with the Mirror several years ago, Paul Burrell revealed details of a particularly shocking conversation between the two women just months before Diana's death.  He revealed further details about their difficult relationship at Diana's inquest . The telephone conversation referred to Diana's relationships with heart surgeon Hasnat Khan and businessman Gulu Lalvani. Mr Burrell said: I heard her call, Paul, come quick. She was hanging over the banister shouting down. She waved me over with her hand. I joined her on the floor cross-legged and stuck close beside her. I leant my ear as near to the phone as possible and listened to the conversation - albeit one-way. It was the slurring voice of Mrs Frances Shand Kydd. What I heard was a torrent of abuse, swearing and upsetting innuendo towards the Princess and towards the male company she was keeping.  It was a hate-filled personal attack on the men and their religious beliefs. The conversation ended when Diana slammed the phone, and Mr Burrell later found her sitting on the lounge floor crying. He claims Diana vowed never to speak to her mother again - and she never did. He said: How prophetic and sad those words were - because she didn't. It is something her mother will have to live with for the rest of her life. At Diana's inquest, Mr Burrell was asked to speak about the phone conversations she had asked him to listen into. However he was hesitant, replying simply: Respectfully that's not very kind to a lady who's no longer here.

title: royals levels heres how prince
story: NewsRoyals' A-levels: Here's how Prince Harry, Meghan Markle, Prince William and Kate Middleton did at schoolWhile some of the royal family did as well as you may think others achieved just a handful of qualifications - and one achieved noneShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByRachel Bishop10:37, 16 AUG 2018Updated23:12, 16 AUG 2018News (Image: Tim Graham Photo Library)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailWith private educations and millions of pounds behind them you'd expect the royals to do pretty well at school. But while some did as well as you may think, others achieved just a handful of qualifications - and one particularly high profile royal achieved none. Despite having what has been described as an aptitude for learning, The Queen didn't have time for formal schooling, having to instead learn the constitutional monarchy ropes from a young age. In contrast, her children and grandchildren have enjoyed a more normal education - and varying degrees of success to show for it.   So how do the royals qualifications measure up? Prince William From 1990, William attended Ludgrove School in Berkshire for five years until he started at Eton College in 1995 where he took his GCSEs and A Levels. He left Eton in 2000 achieving an A in Geography B Art and C Biology. Like many students, The Duke of Cambridge chose to have a gap year before beginning his university course in order to travel and gain a variety of new experiences. He went on to gain a 2:1 degree in Geography at St Andrews University in Scotland, which is where he met his wife, while they were students in residence at St Salvator's Hall.   The Duke of Cambridge initially began a four-year History of Art degree in 2001 but changed his major to Geography after two years.  The Duchess of Cambridge Kate achieved 11 GCSEs at St. Andrew’s School in Pangbourne in 1995 and then went on to Marlborough College in Wiltshire, where she achieved As in Maths and Art, and a B in English. Leaving Marlborough College in July 2000, The Duchess of Cambridge undertook a gap year in which she studied at the British Institute in Florence, undertook a Raleigh International programme in Chile, and crewed on Round the World Challenge boats in the Solent. Kate graduated from St Andrews University in 2005 with a 2:1 in History of Art  Prince Harry Probably one of the least academic achievers is Prince Harry, who studied at Eton, gaining 11 GCSE's and a B in Art and D in Geography in his A Levels. On the royal's website it simply says: His Royal Highness went on to Eton College from September 1998 where he took his GCSEs and A Levels. On William's it outlines the three A Levels he took. Harry had plenty of successes though throughout his education and during his time at Eton, he was House Captain of Games and represented the school at rugby, cricket and polo, and was a member of the Combined Cadet Force.  He left in 2003 and joined the Army, but before doing so, he spent a year travelling to Australia, Argentina and Africa, where he made a documentary about the plight of orphans in Lesotho.  The Duchess of Sussex, Meghan Markle Meghan began her secondary education at Immaculate Heart High School in 1992 where she was known as a hard working and focused student. During her high school years, The Duchess of Sussex performed in theatrical productions at both Immaculate Heart and Loyola High School. Her former drama teacher, Gigi Perreau, who directed Meghan in seven plays, remembered that her former student sparkled.  She said: You see someone nice to the other kids, who gets good grades, doesn't say anything bad about anybody. America does not test students using GCSEs or A Levels, and it has not been reported what Meghan got on her SATs (which is the test students take as an entry into university) but it is known that she got the grades she needed to get into university. She went on gain a double major in Theatre and International Relations at Northwestern University in Evanston, Illinois in 2003. During her time at university, The Duchess completed an internship at the US Embassy in Buenos Aires, Argentina, where she learned to speak Spanish. She also studied French for six years.  The Queen She's met politicians and film stars, speaks French fluently, loves to colour block and still rides a horse at 92 years of age, but the Queen has never sat an academic exam in her life meaning she hasn't a single GCSE or A Level (O Levels back then) to her name. In her early childhood, the Queen was taught by a governess from 9.30am until 11am. Following the abdication of her uncle Edward VIII in 1938, Elizabeth needed to prepare herself for her future role and received lessons on constitutional history from the vice provost of Eton, Henry Marten. The Queen’s father had disliked school and her mother thought it was more important to have fun,’ Professor Kate Williams, author of Young Elizabeth told Good Housekeeping . Unlike her father, the Queen was and is very bright and had an appetite for learning as well as a razor sharp memory. The lack of a formal education didn't harm her as she's naturally analytical and something of an autodidact, as well as being hard working - which we know now is just as important as raw brainpower.    Prince Charles Prince Charles was educated at Gordonstoun where he achieved five O-levels (GCSEs) and two A-levels - a B in History and a C in French. He then went on to Cambridge University where he achieved a 2:2 degree in History Legend has it his bodyguard who was present at all lectures with the young prince sat the exams too - and got a First. Princes Diana Princess Diana met with less success and failed all her O-levels, twice. However she apparently excelled in deportment, having attended finishing school in Switzerland.  Princess Anne, Prince Andrew and Prince Edward Princess Anne, the Princess Royal, attended Benenden school in Kent where she gained six O-levels, and three A-levels in English, History and Politics. While Prince Andrew attended Gordonstoun like his older brother, his academic choices were much like Anne's - six O-levels and A-levels in English, History and Politics. Perhaps unsurprisingly, Prince Edward also went to Gordonstoun and has nine O-levels, three A-levels in English, History and Politics. He then gained a 2:2 degree in History from Cambridge University.

title: voice mirror its over you
story: NewsopinionVoice of The Mirror: Over to you on Princess Eugenie's royal wedding bill, AndyHer Majesty is famously frugal, serving regally without wasting resources. What a pity we cannot say that about the extended familyShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByVoice of the Mirror22:39, 16 AUG 2018Updated22:42, 16 AUG 2018NewsopinionPrincess Eugenie and her fiance Jack Brooksbank will marry in October (Image: PA)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailEnough is enough. Taxpayers should not foot a &pound2million bill so an over-entitled minor royal enjoys a grand wedding. If Prince Andrew, so notorious for his extravagance at the cost the public purse that he is nicknamed Air Miles Andy, wants a Harry and Meghan-style Windsor extravaganza for daughter Eugenie and her tequila salesman fiance Jack Brooksbank, let the father-of-the-bride pick up the tab, just like any other dad. With the NHS under severe strain, homelessness rising and the living standards of millions of ordinary families squeezed, what an unforgivable waste it would be to subsidise a jamboree with a hefty security bill. We wish the couple every happiness but they must scale back this wedding and behave responsibly – not take taxpayers for a ride. Her Majesty is famously frugal, serving regally without wasting resources. What a pity we cannot say that about the extended family.  Our A-list stars LET’S celebrate the success of A-level students in Britain and avoid the annual carping by miseries wrongly claiming exams are easier than in the old days. Pupils these days are better taught by some of the best teachers ever to grace classrooms but we beg the Government: Stop interfering. Since the bad old days of Tory meddler-in-chief Michael Gove, it has been a battle for education professionals to come to terms with upheavals in marking, tests replacing course work and grading. We are lucky Gove was not allowed to switch to Roman numerals and Latin. So congratulations to everybody who did well and let’s give a second chance to the disappointed.  Say a prayer Aretha Franklin was a incredibly gifted performer who united a racially divided America through her music. The Queen of Soul was born without privilege but made the most of a fantastic voice. The world has lost an extraordinary woman who produced a soundtrack for so many lives.

title: meghan markle reveals thoughts people
story: NewsMeghan Markle revealed thoughts about people who 'lie and manipulate' after divorce to first husbandMeghan Markle shared this profound quote from Portuguese author Jose Micard Tiexera on her website The Tig back in 2014Share&nbsp&nbspCommentsByNeil Murphy03:19, 17 AUG 2018Updated05:58, 17 AUG 2018NewsThe post was recently uncovered on Instagram (Image: EMPICS)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailMeghan Markle vowed to stop wasting time on people who 'lie and manipulate' in a recently unearthed online post. The Duchess of Sussex's relationship with her family has been closely scrutinised in recent months as Buckingham Palace struggles to prevent further embarrassing media interviews by her father Markle and half-sister Samantha. The 37-year-old royal described how she has little tolerance for those she considers 'dishonest' or 'disloyal' in a post shared to her now defunct website, The Tig, in 2014.  The quote is attributed to Portuguese author Jose Micard Tiexera and was recently reshared by Instagram account harry_meghan_updates.   It read: I no longer have patience for certain things, not because I’ve become arrogant, but simply because I reached a point in my life where I do not want to waste more time with what displeases me or hurts me.  I lost the will to please those who do not like me, to love those who do not love me and to smile at those who do not want to smile at me. I no longer spend a single minute on those who lie or want to manipulate. In friendship I dislike the lack of loyalty and betrayal, it continues. I do not get along with those who do not know how to give a compliment or a word of encouragement. The post is believed to have been published shortly after her split from her first husband film producer Trevor Engeleson in 2011. The pair divorced in 2013 - just two years after exchanging vows at their lavish wedding in Jamaica.  The post may also be aimed at her former maid-of-honour whom she is no longer on speaking terms with.  The pair reportedly fell out over Meghan's treatment of her former spouse and following her relocation to Toronto to take a role in the TV show Suits.
